meta.notes: Data-driven NPC tables for Skazka World (no pronouns). Occupations + Contexts in JSON. Names removed (handled by names.json).

temperaments.label: Phlegmatic
temperaments.hint: Calm and steady; slow to anger.

temperaments.label: Melancholic
temperaments.hint: Thoughtful and cautious; prone to worry.

temperaments.label: Amiable
temperaments.hint: Warm and easy to get along with.

motivations.label: Take control of a lucrative corner
Gain entry to a powerful guild

secrets.label: Being blackmailed by a minor noble
Illegitimate heir to a minor title
Keeps a ‘black book’ of clients and bribes
Signed away something vital for power

quirks.label: Writes everything into a tiny ledger
Stares into the middle distance mid-talk
Always a little dusted with flour or dust
Keeps mystery herb pouches on a cord
Keeps pockets full of dried petals
Won’t cross running water after dusk
Wears a saint’s fingerbone in a locket
Keeps a pet rook on shoulder
Taps a rhythm that never repeats
Speaks only if given a password

speech_patterns.label: “Ask not what hunts you—ask why it hasn’t yet.”
“Cross me once, and I’ll bury you twice.”
“The city eats its young. I just set the table.”
“The dead keep secrets better than the living.”
“If the gods cared, they’d show their faces.”
“You can drown in a thimble if you’re cursed.”
“Keep the lantern high. Not for the road.”
“Heaven is far. The gallows are near.”
“I hear the river speaking. It wants you gone.”
“One more lie and the mirror cracks.”
“You don’t need eyes to see a trap.”
“Fate is a rigged game; I loaded the dice.”
“We don’t keep monsters in cages. We rent them rooms.”
“A saint’s bone and a sinner’s coin weigh the same.”
“Your luck makes a lovely sound when it breaks.”
“It’s not paranoia if the walls whisper back.”
“The world ends nightly. Most sleep through it.”
“I drink to forget and remember what to forget.”

micro_hooks.label: Their shipment is late; suspects sabotage
Shepherd found a preserved bog body
New noble decree angers the market
A ledger went missing the same night a rival prospered
A batch made people ill; was it sabotage?
Tools scream or rattle at night, witnesses swear

complications.label: The presumed villain is actually innocent
Quiet bribes keep matters from open court
A contract has infernal small print
Owes a debt to a dockside gang
Secret informant for the city watch
Under a minor curse (teeth fall out weekly)
Buried a body in the old quarry
Stole a relic from the temple
Bitten by something in the sewers
Has a twin they pretend is dead
Swore an oath never to shed blood
Cursed to speak only riddles at night
An apprentice ran away with secrets
Blood on their hands (and they liked it)
A demon knows their true name
Voices urge them to light fires
Owes drinks to half the town
Has a bounty on their head
